body:
I thought I was getting a similar issue for android dev from windows machine
But it was caused by being connected to a VPN ðŸ¤¦

Getting this same issue. Specifically, this is my output
```
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [hyper_util::client::legacy::pool] checkout waiting for idle connection: ("http", 192.0.0.2:1420)
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [reqwest::connect] starting new connection: http://192.0.0.2:1420/
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [hyper_util::client::legacy::connect::http] Http::connect; scheme=Some("http"), host=Some("192.0.0.2"), port=Some(Port(1420))
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [hyper_util::client::legacy::connect::http] connecting to 192.0.0.2:1420
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [hyper_util::client::legacy::connect::http] connect error for 192.0.0.2:1420: ConnectError("tcp connect error", Os { code: 4, kind: Interrupted, message: "Interrupted system call" })
Apr 19 22:26:32 tauri-moondream[39298] <Notice>: [hyper_util::client::legacy::pool] checkout dropped for ("http", 192.0.0.2:1420)
```

Edit: My issue is with `tauri ios dev`

I ended up seeing similar issues on iOS, and in my case the issue was not having ios device and development machine on the same correctly configured network

https://discord.com/channels/616186924390023171/1227758916872441856/1233199411681689621

I'm getting the same error on my Android device, but it also happens with the `tauri dev` command.

Does anyone know why these requests are happening via WiFi?
The best UX would be to have the same thing as CapacitorJS... where everything happens through the USB cable.

I don't know about iOS, but Android has this very neat thing called `adb reverse` that can forward any network calls made to a port to the ADB connection. For example:
```
adb reverce tcp:3000 tcp:3000
```
Makes it so when you access your phone's `localhost:3000` you'll be actually accessing your Laptop's `localhost:3000`

React Native uses that technique and we could probably use that in Tauri too... removing the need for these devices to share a common connection ( like Wifi ). Maybe iOS has a similar thing too
same error
I resolve this problem by change devUrl:"http://localhost:1420" to http://0.0.0.0:1420 or your PC ip in tauri.conf.json.

Is debugging over usb/wireless even supported or do I need to have an android emulator ready?

Can you please retry with `-rc.2` and confirm it is still an issue?
We changed default behavior on the release candidate and we support emulator and usb connection.

iOS requires the ip of the tun device as mentioned in the blogpost https://v2.tauri.app/blog/tauri-2-0-0-release-candidate/#development-server-for-mobile but Android should work without modification.

Connection over USB on android still returns the same error on this setup even in a new project made using `pnpm create tauri-app --rc`:

When I run `tauri android dev`, vite doesn't host the page on the network, rather only locally.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ea41b5f-b517-4b3b-ac37-58edcf56b786)

And because in Vite config `server.host` is set to false only if `process.env.TAURI_DEV_HOST` returns as undefined, the outcome would suggest that it does, in fact return undefined. (that, as well as the `@ts-expect-error` comment above the `const host = process.env.TAURI_DEV_HOST;`)

Could that be related to this issue?

I am getting the same error when I run `tauri android dev`

 One correction info is that I am pretty sure I am using `vite` which comes default with `Nuxt`. But it is showing the bundler as `webpack`.
 
 In my case, I can get it to work by changing the devUrl from `localhost` to my actual network IP.

I succeeded in solving the problem, and the method was very simple. Change 'beforeDevCommand' in 'tauri.config.json' to 'pnpm dev --host' to make web content accessible on the LAN. Then change the IP in 'devUrl' to the developer's computer, so that the mobile phone can get web resources from the computer.

Looks like the port forwarding is failing for some reason. Investigating atm.
I see the port forwarding can fail if there's more than one device connected. Let's see if there's a way to fix it.

> 
> iOS requires the ip of the tun device as mentioned in the blogpost https://v2.tauri.app/blog/tauri-2-0-0-release-candidate/#development-server-for-mobile but Android should work without modification.

Now, running `tauri ios dev` successfully on connected iOS device, thank you.

I'm also getting this error, but I am not sure if its because I'm using https locally for a self signed cert or not. I am running Vite locally for my dev url and using the --host option to open up the network. I can hit the url with Safari directly but I need to accept the cert first. I don't see anything in the logs related to certs or https so it seems like a network issue.

I'm on 2.0.0-rc.7

>  https locally for a self signed cert

Sounds maybe unrelated, as these need to be added to the system CA store as webviews (not browsers) just block insecure connection by default (afaik).
